Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: karthikprasannan
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in Bartolomeo from 30th aug to 2nd sept 2011 The hotel is very close to the Rialto bridge and is like 15mins away frm san marco. The hotel room was big and very well kept and clean.The staff were very friendly and helpful and they have free breakfast. They charge 4 euros for the internet though.Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: M S
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bartolomeo was an absolute delight of a hotel. It was just right: great location, wonderful customer service, clean & comfortable room and simply convenient. The staff were friendly, courteous and very helpful. There is air conditioning in the rooms. The bathrooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Check-out is at 10:30 in the morning, but if your flight isn't until later and you want to walk around like I did, the hotel has a secure storage facility for you to leave your bags. The hotel is just a nice top-off for the beautiful sites of such a unique city as Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: allig33
Reviews.Content: Overall: Good service, cleanliness and location The service at the hotel was excellent--the reception people speak several languages (well). This was helpful. The location is PERFECT for Venice. You can arrive by foot from the train station or take a vaporetto (website has helpful map and directions--hotels are hard to find in Venice--definitely use their map!!) The room was good for a 3*--small, simple and clean. The best part was the bathroom--fairly recently redone and very clean. There is Ac in each room...but it wasn't as strong as I would have wished. I think this was only a problem because we were on the top floor in the heat of summer. Breakfast is your typical Italian 3* breakfast: rolls, cakes, caned fruit, juice, yogurt, etc. There is no elevator - if this is an issue for you. There are only 4 floors total so the climb is never that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to find but great value rooms and nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: caitykiss
Reviews.Content: Once we found our hotel it was well worth it, despite going on what felt like a wild goose chase to get there. Bring a map with clear directions of how to locate the hotel, it is through many windy streets! Our room was beautiful, very specious and well decorated and had air conditioning which was great. very comfortable king size bed. the breakfast was great too and consisted of a good variety. The location of the hotel, just near rialto bridge was fantastic, and in a great spot considering it was the cheapest we found and was quite good value for an expensive city like venice. staff were lovely and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the location”
Reviews.Author: MindyPDX
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable but the breakfast was lacking. There was free wifi. The location was great and the front desk staff was helpful. We would stay here again based on the location.

Reviews.Title: “Only a 2*star hotel at best”
Reviews.Author: Islanders09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple, stayed here for 3 nights in May. We were not expecting a great hotel based on the hotel rating and reviews we read on Trip Advisor, however, we were still disappointed with what we got. Our biggest issue was that the hotel advertised as having air-conditioning, and although it may have an air-conditioning system installed, it had not yet been turned on for the year when we arrived. The temperatures were mid-twenties in Venice during our stay, and being on the 4th floor of a small, poorly ventilated hotel, with very very tiny rooms, it was well above thirty degrees in our rooms, which made sleepy impossible. We complained to the front desk about this and the only response we got was "the boss hasn't turned it on yet". We advised the staff that the hotel advertised as having air-conditioning, with no mention of it being operational only seasonally, however, the staff did not seem at all concerned with our complaints. The "boss" was not contacted about the complaint. The breakfast at the hotel was also quite disappointing. It consisted of canned pears and prunes, yogurt, bread rolls, and one cereal option. This would not have been so bad if they kept replenishing the supply of those items, however, often the yogurt tray was empty and the canned fruit was all gone and it would take a very long time for them to get refilled, if they did at all. The only good thing about this hotel is the location near the Rialto Bridge (but still quite difficult to find). However, for the price paid I'm sure we could have found much nicer hotels in same area. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location, very bad beds”
Reviews.Author: Marducita
Reviews.Content: - Location: very well located, close to the Rialto bridge and within walking distance from the Piazza San Marco. Being in a city with no cars, that's great as we didn't have to walk much with suitcases on arrival and departure, to take the vaporetto in Rialto bridge. - Room: the room was ok, clean and big, but not very nice: I didn't like the decoration and the furniture (both cheap). But that wasn't so bad. The worst part was the bed: the matresses were hard, as in broken, there were loose springs in different places and it hurt all over our bodies. Very uncomfortable beds, so we didn't sleep very well. They offered us to change rooms but said the matresses were the same in all rooms. We also had a problem with the heating, which made a horrible, loud noise, and it was fixed by the third night. The bathroom was fine, recently renovated and big. The only problem was the lack of shower curtain (there was a tub), but it was ok because the shower didn't wet too much the floor. - Internet: free wifi on the room - Breakfast: the breakfast room is small, but going early we managed to find a table. The breakfast itself was fine. - Staffl: the best part of this hotel is the staff: very helpful and nice men, always with a smile, willing to solve any problem or to help with city questions. Great customer service. - Conclusion: given the very reasonable price of this hotel, I think that if they only changed the matresses for new, good ones, they would improve a lot the quality of the stay and the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean and very conventiently-located!”
Reviews.Author: flowermenza
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bartolomeo is very conveniently located in the heart of Venice...almost a 1-minute walk from Rialto Bridge and the water-bus stop. Its price is also competitive and the room amenities are very good. Staff are more than helpful and they will do their best to ensure that you get right directions or choose the best venue to go for or event to attend. The only drawback I can think of is the fact that it was a bit noisy down the street where my room was located. But then I guess this somehow comes with Venice due to its relatively narrow -yet beautiful- streets and adjacent buildings. Overall, it's a very good hotel to stay at while in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: kutlu
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that the reviews were concentrated on how difficult it was to find this hotel, we have made our choice and stayed there for 3 days. Yes, it is a little bit difficult to find but not impossible. Just follow the instructions on the web site and there you go. Do not hesitate to ask anybody. The hotel is very well placed; only 2 minutes to Rialto bridge and 15 minutes to San Marco. Breakfast was fine, and the staff was very helpful and friendly - everyone of them.

Reviews.Title: “The staff made it worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: travelcritic22
Reviews.Content: We picked the Bartolomeo for it's location....not wanting to drag our suitcases too far once we got off the water bus. It was still hard to find but that's part of the allure of Venice. Our room was clean and had everything we needed except space. Our 3rd floor room overlooked a small courtyard which was very noisey much of the time thanks to a restaurant. But all in all, it was a charming hotel. The best part of all was the hotel staff, especially Ennio.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: JuliaNorthampton_UK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an Italian holiday covering Bologna, Venice and Tuscany, staying 4 nights at the Bartolomeo while in Venice. What a brilliant location - just a short walk away from the Rialto bridge yet quiet at night. What we hadn't realised is that Rialto is one of the locations signposted from just about anywhere (along with St.Marks and the railway station) so finding our way home was never a problem. The hotel is no frills and breakfast is uninspiring but adequate, but for the price we paid in Venice this was exactly what we expected - the location was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: marvinToronto
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just returned from a trip to Italy and while in Venice, we stayed at the Hotel Bartolomeo. We had arrived by train and then took the vaporetto to the Rialto stop. It was a fairly short walk to the hotel through the campo San Bartolomeo. There were signs posted to help find the hotel. It is located down an alley off the campo. This was a wonderful location to set out from on our exploration of Venice. The front desk staff was wonderful. The front desk clerks were very helpful and friendly. There is no elevator. The hotel was very quiet and well kept. I had brought a north american extension cord for my CPAP machine in case, the electrical outlet was far from the bed, but found that I did not need it. I had a converter for the plug already. I then gave the cord to the front desk staff advising them that they might have a north american guest sometime in the future who many need it. They accepted it graciously. The room on the 3rd floor, ( north american fourth floor)was small but clean and tidy. We had reqeusted two single beds and they provided them. The bathroom was equipped with a bidet and a hairdryer along with a sink, toilet and corner shower stall. I am not a large person but found the shower stall very small. If you dropped the soap and bent over to pick it up, your back would lean against the handle of the water supply and shut off the water. However I found this to be the case in the hotel in Florence we had just come from. The wardrope was large enough for two people and it had a wall safe. There was no refrigerator. There was a wall mounted television with many channels but none in English. The windows opened on to a small court where the residents of the surrounding buildings hung their laundry. You felt you were really living in the neighbourhood. Breakfast was included and consisted of cereal, fruit cocktail, various breads with cheese, butter and jam. Also baked sweet rools and yogurt were provided. To drink there was tea, coffee and two types of fruit juice. The breakfast was enough to keep you going until lunch. As Venice can be quite expensive we found this hotel to be fairly priced and comfortable. The neighbourhood was full of shopping opportunities, wine and cheese shops as well as the many choices of stalls on the Rialto bridge and over to the far side of the grand canal. There were many restaurants as well and many had a tourist menu offering 3 courses for a set price. Although we had bought a 3 day unlimited pass for the vaporetti and used it all the time, Venice I found was quite small and you could walk to almost anywhere you wanted. The pass was a very good value. We also took the vaporetto to the Lido and to the island of Murano. The vaporetti are quick, efficient and comfortable. All in all I can honestly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a quiet, safe, clean,well priced, and strategically located hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Bartolomeo in the middle of June 2008. The location is second to none - literally 2 minutes from the Rialto Bridge. The hotel was very clean and the staff very helpful. We had previously read a review on Trip advisor reccomending that you request a high room in the hotel to reduce the noise levels. If you are travelling in the summer months - DO NOT DO THIS!! Hot air rises and our room (on the top floor) was like a sauna. The temperature within the room did not drop below 30 Degrees all night and was very unconfortable. We spoke to the hotel staff who were very accomodating and moved us to the 1st floor which was much cooler. As many of the reviews state there is no lift so be prepared to carry your bacgs up quite a few flights of stairs. The staff were friendly, the hotel was clean and reasonably priced and the location was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Price”
Reviews.Author: MH0873
Reviews.Content: This is a great 2*hotel. You are going to get what you pay for in venice for the price the location and the rooms cannot be faulted. The hotel is a 2 min walk from Rialto Bridge and the Grand Canal and a 10 min walk from St Mark's Square. The staff are really friendly and happy to give advice on restaurants and locations. The rooms are very clean and compact but dont expect the Ritz. You do get what you pay for but if you want a hotel in the centre just to sleep in and feel comfortable whilst you are there this isnt a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: amanda_grimm
Reviews.Content: What a fun hotel. Make sure you have a map with you when trying to find this place. When you get to san marco plaza there are signs, but like most of venice, it's like a rat maze and you will absolutely need your map to find anything. Hotel was typical for europe, clean yet small. But not too cramped. We were on the top floor, and that will be an issue for anyone who can't walk many, many stairs to the top floor. Beds were TERRIBLE. If you need a good bed, don't stay here. I literally rolled into the wall and smacked my face against it in the middle of the night. I'm a good sleeper though so I never woke up sore or had a bad nights sleep. breakfast was typical cold, european. good selection though. some fresh fruit for cereal, yogurt, breads, toasts, spreads, coffee, tea. staff made this hotel worth it. Very friendly, great suggestions on places to visit. this location was great because it was in the middle of venice so you could literally get to all the little neighborhoods no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and an unbelievable 2* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lijil
Reviews.Content: Could not have picked a better location if we paid five times as much! This hotel was awesome. It's right around the corner from the Rialto Bridge and 5 minutes walk (if you don't get lost) to St Marks. Breakfast was good, bed was comfortable and the room was clean and extremely spacious for European standards. Just beware that there is no lift which is probably the only thing keeping it from being a 3 star hotel (currently 2 star). Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: kizzibee
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a trip to Venice where we stayed at the Hotel Bartolomeo. We booked through Venere and got a good price, we also checked reviews on TA and it all looked good. We found the hotel really easily. We got a map from the hotel's own website. It is right next to the Rialto Bridge and next to a public toilet, so easy to find. The staff at the hotel speak excellent english. They were friendly and helpful. There are no lifts at the hotel. We were only on the first floor but I think there were 5 or 6 floors so thank goodness we weren't higher! Our room was small but VERY clean as was the bathroom, although the shower was small and cramped for my tall husband. The only issue (a small one) was breakfast. It was extremely basic - bread, cheese, tea, coffee, fruit juice. I would have liked something more to eat but this seems to be the italian way and the majority of resturants don't serve breakfast. The breakfast room was also very small and on one occassion we, and several other couples, could not get seated. I recommend having an early lunch at about 11 or 12 and a later dinner.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Ppessa
Reviews.Content: If you're staying in Venice you should stay here. My sister and I paid 80 E in the thick of August and it was a bargain. The rooms have been renovated. The bathroom was pristine. Fantastic water pressure with hot water, a large enclosed shower (not on top of a toilet!), and a large window - windows in bathrooms are great! Oh and they had fluffy towels - not the seer sucker cotton towels found in other Italian hotels. The room was not large but it didn't need to be. The beds were comfortable - including the pillows. It was quiet and literally around the corner from the Rialto bridge. Breakfast was pretty good - we chose yoghurt and muesli. The staff were incredibly nice and had some good suggestions for restaurants. Incredible value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Prinsarma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sister hotel of the Hotel Bartolomeo, the Rio Alto, for 3 days in July. We booked online, they were very prompt and courteous with their responses. At $162 USD/night we were pleased since Venice is so expensive. The pros of the place - first of all, the location can't be beat. It is located a very short walk away from the Rialto bridge and its vaporetto stop, and the San Marco piazza is also close, less than 10 minutes if you walk at a normal pace, 15-20 if you linger and deliberately go off track like we did! The staffmembers at the front desk were knowledgeable, helpful and very friendly. We had room #1 which had a canal view and a view of a little bridge nearby, great for people watching. However, despite overlooking a large amount of foot traffic, the room was very quiet once we shut the windows and shutters. The room itself was a decent size, spotless and had a nice bathroom with a good strong shower. There was also a little fridge/minibar. The AC worked very well. Breakfast was relatively simple but adequate. There were juices, yogurt, cereal, bread, cheese, tea, coffee and some fruit (the fruit was canned, not fresh the day that we went). There were a few cons, but these were minor. Like many other places, be prepared to lug suitcases up some steep stairs as there is no elevator. The bed was a little hard for my tastes, although the pillows were thick and soft. BTW, as everyone says a good map is definitely needed for Venice. We tried 4 different ones and by far the most detailed and accurate was the Rough Guide map. I would definitely stay there again. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good location”
Reviews.Author: 4eric
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well situated about half way between Rialto bridge and San Marco square. Down a side street and a little hard to find but map on website was good. Rooms were spartanly furnished but very clean, bathroom was ultra modern, large, all marble and well equipped. Our room on second floor was close to breakfast area and was a little noisy in the AM from early risers but we wanted to get up anyway. Breakfast was good: cereals, breads, rolls, juices, good coffee, cheeses and ham. Front desk very helpful and friendly. They recommended a restaurent (Bruno's) up the street which was excellent -- we ate there twice. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Zot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location - about 2 minutes walk to the Rialto Bridge! The best way to get to the hotel from Marco Polo Airport is by orange water bus line as this takes you to the Rialto stop. If you have a good map (which you WILL need for Venice) then the hotel is easy to find. It is not down a dangerous street at all! The street is merely a bit dark. The hotel is very clean and the room we had was very spacious. The main problem we had was our room was right next to the breakfast room and therefore from about 7:15am a lot of noise could be heard in setting up the breakfast things. Also our room was next to a ventilation shaft from the building next door and this noise went until about 11pm. Other than those noises the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in the heart of Venice for a great price”
Reviews.Author: SwannTraveller
Reviews.Content: Like many things in Venice, this hotel was hard to find. But when we did manage to find it, we were extremely impressed with its location, right near the Rialto Bridge in the heart of Venice. I would describe the rooms as a bit rustic, but they had character. The hotel was very clean and well-kept. Beds were comfortable. Note to younger travellers: the hotel locks its doors around midnight. Luckily we had a cell phone that worked in Italy, as we had to call the hotel in order to alert the front desk attendant that we were locked out. He said if we would have let him know what time we planned to be back, he would have waited downstairs. Aside from that incident, the hotel staff were lovely and gave great advice. Overall, we had an excellent stay. For the price and the location, you can't beat this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay here at the Hotel Bartolomeo. It was a little dark and small when we first entered, but got used to it pretty quickly. The bathroom was immaculately clean, water temp and pressure were great, but our AC did not work. It wasn't terribly hot inside the room, so that was fine. We found this place ok, but you do need to follow the directions closely. Also, for some reason, when we first arrived, we decided to walk the way from the train station and that's probably not the best idea because of the bridges you need to go up and down and also it was way too difficult to fight through the crowds with our luggage, not to mention the cobblestone paths. I suggest you take the vaparetto or some sort of water transportation. :) Otherwise, the location was great, very central. It's set off to the side of the "main tourist road" so it was nice without the murmurs of voices. But there is a restaurant downstairs so you may hear some dishes clanging late at night or early in the morning from the kitchen below. Breakfast was very simple consisting of bread, packaged toasts, coffee, no meat. The front desk was always very warm and helpful with all of our touristy questions and allowed us to store our luggage after check out. =) All in all, we were pleased with this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: seek2know
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Venice with my sister two weeks ago and we both found Hotel Bartolomeo to be one of our best experiences. It is very clean and yes, the bathroom was new. No leaks and plenty of hot water. The reception people were wonderful, advised us on everything and stored our luggage on the last day so we could sightsee comfortably. We stayed on the second floor, and the only noise was from people coming down the stairs to breakfast in the morning. The breakfast is basic, but enough to get you started and we found the pizza in Venice to be the chaepest and best of anywhere we travelled, so lunch was to be looked forward to! The reviewer that found the "calle" or alley the hotel is down to be a bit frightening is not exaggerating! However, once you go down it, you realise there are lots of people around, and at night there is a bar and a restaurant open, so it is not at all dangerous at all. It is just the way Venice is designed, and once you are used to the narrow calles, it is so charming and delightful to go down them and see what lies ahead. A note to people driving to Venice: When you park in the covered lot and get out of your car, there may be men directing you to the boats to Venice. Ask them what the fare is, and if it is 10 Euros, start looking for the signs for the water buses! These guys are directing you to water taxis, which do not give you a choice as to where you get off! Furthermore, the places they stop at are diificult to disembark, we had to jump across a yawning gap and they threw our luggage after us! The water bus on the other hand, is cheap and they have a tourist pass that can be used as many times as you want. The water bus goes right from the parking lot to San Marco square, or the Rialto bridge, or anywhere else. It also gives you a lovely tour of the Grand Canal along the way. The stops have nice smooth landing places that are level and you can pull your luggage off in a civilised manner.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Bartolomeo
HotelInfo.Address: S.Marco 5494, 30124 Venice, Italy
